titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Levi S. Howes papers, 1897-1967

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Ann Mulfort January 2013

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

phystech.head: System Requirements
phystech.p: Popular music recordings -- 78 rpm phonograph records.

bioghist.head: Biography of Levi S. Howes
bioghist.p: Levi S. Howes (1872-1967) operated the Circle Bar Ranch, located on the Otter River in Powder River County, Montana. He also held business interests in Sheridan, Wyoming.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection contains a handwritten and typescript copy of Howes' unpublished autobiography "Montana: The Reminiscences of Levi S. Howes" (ca. 1927); a certificate of Howes' membership in the National Cowboy Hall of Fame; newspaper clippings; 2 1929 letters from noted western artist and family friend Elling William "Bill" Gollings to Levi's daughter Dorothy Howes Stevens; photographs of the ranch, Howes and his family, and of a visit to the ranch by Bill Gollings and Will Rogers (1897-1967); and a collection of 78 rpm phonograph records of popular music. All of the manuscript materials are photocopies.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on the materials for research purposes, and the collection is open to the public.

userestrict.head: Copyright Information
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for observing all copyright, property, and libel laws as they apply.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: There are no known other archival collections created by Levi S. Howes at the date of processing.

originalsloc.head: Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: The donor retains possession of the original manuscript materials which are photocopies in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Item Description, Box Number, Folder Number, Collection Name, Collection Number, American Heritage Center, University of Wyoming.
